title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

08:13 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:24 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:27 <kwoot> has joined #xwiki  
08:29 <kwoot> Guys, I am seriously impressed. http://balsamiq.com/products/mockups/xwiki. I knew xwiki was cool, just not this cool.  
08:33 <vmassol> kwoot: great, glad you're impressed although I guess the merit is more on the balsamiq tool on this one! :)  
08:48 <kwoot> True, but nevertheless, it is available for xwiki.  
08:48 <vmassol> yep  
08:50 <vmassol> kwoot: what's your real name?  
08:50 <kwoot> Jeroen Baten  
08:50 <vmassol> ah yes  
08:50 <vmassol> always forget  
08:50 <kwoot> no problem.  
08:50 <vmassol> you've won an entry on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/References/Testimonials :)  
08:51 <kwoot> :-) And also in the IRC log off today off course :-)  
08:52 <vmassol> yeah I'll link to that  
08:52 <kwoot> [me and my big mouth] :-)  
08:52 <vmassol> done :  
08:52 <vmassol> :)

10:07 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <+Enygma`> there are some display issues with the ExtensionSheet for Plugins. (example http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Ratings+Plugin)  
10:36 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: looking  
10:36 <+Enygma`> tmortagne: thanks  
10:37 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: do you remember what it's supposed to be instead of the error ?  
10:38 <+Enygma`> nothing AFAIK, just "Plugin (?)Obsolete"  
10:38 <+tmortagne> that's weird then since the plugin part is properly displayed  
10:38 <+Enygma`> yes  
10:38 <+Enygma`> don`t know where that exception is coming from  
10:38 <+Enygma`> and it's only for plugins AFAICS  
10:39 <+tmortagne> looks like the issue is with Bundled With  
10:39 <+tmortagne> since I don't see it  
10:39 <+tmortagne> and that's where it is in other extensions  
10:47 <+tmortagne> looks like the issue comes form the tooltip actually  
10:47 <+tmortagne> yep  
10:48 <+tmortagne> looks like it's the macro {{tooltip}} itself which is failing  
10:48 <+tmortagne> vmassol: is it a wiki macro or it's a standard java one ?  
10:49 <+tmortagne> given the error it looks like a wiki macro  
10:49 <+tmortagne> trying to find it  
10:50 <+tmortagne> found it and indeed it's broken  
10:53 <+tmortagne> Fixed  
10:53 <+tmortagne> was probably dues to Velocity 1.7  
10:54 <+tmortagne> looks like now when you have  
10:54 <+tmortagne> $somevar.somegetter(%notvelocity  
10:54 <+tmortagne> velocity see that as invalid syntax even when there is no $somevar.somegetter() method  
10:59 <vmassol> otp

11:46 <+Enygma`> tmortagne: now the tooltip on the obsolete warning of plugins works for me too :) It did not work previously on Firefox and Fedora

14:08 <pturcotte> has quit  
14:11 <polx> has quit  
14:13 <vmassol> cjdelisle: Cassandra 1.0: http://s.apache.org/0l  
14:29 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
14:31 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:32 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: I usually create "upgrade to library x.y" issues as tasks, not improvements  
14:39 <vmassol> sdumitriu: hi. What issue are you referring to?  
14:39 <vmassol> it depends for me  
14:40 <vmassol> if I can think of an improvement brought by the upgrade I list it as improvement in general, otherwise as tak  
14:40 <@sdumitriu> For example, Upgrade to SLF4J 1.6.3 - XCOMMONS-50  
14:40 <vmassol> like I did SLF4J  
14:40 <vmassol> it's a task sdumitriu  
14:41 <@sdumitriu> Right, it is now  
14:41 <@sdumitriu> But initially it was improvement  
14:41 <vmassol> you changed it?  
14:41 <vmassol> I created as a task  
14:41 <vmassol> (I just made a mistake by choosing the wrong project when using jira client)  
14:42 <vmassol> (I had left the initial settings without checking)  
14:42 <vmassol> but more generally speaking we don't have a rule for this  
14:42 <vmassol> tmortagne for example doesn't like to use tasks at all  
14:43 <vmassol> he prefers improvements  
14:43 <vmassol> it's an even more general discussion that we started the other day with tmortagne and you  
14:43 <vmassol> as to when we call stuff "feature", "improvement", "task",  
14:44 <vmassol> we could rename the jira issue types to make them simpler to use  
14:45 <vmassol> and have only 3: "UI Feature", "Improvement", "Bug"  
14:54 <+sburjan> justout of curiosity, why don't we specify in pom's to always take the latest version of our dependencies  ? Because we need to be careful not to break the build accidentally ?  
14:55 <+tmortagne> ( vmassol: I usually use task for upgrades )  
15:10 <lucaa> has quit  
15:18 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: For build reproductibility  
15:19 <@sdumitriu> Like, if I were to try to build 2.1 today, and it didn't specify exactly the versions it needs, I would get a broken build  
15:19 <@sdumitriu> Not the same as the published 2.1, something different  
15:19 <+sburjan> because the change in dependencies have changed since then, and latest dependencies version don't integrate anymore with old xwiki code ?  
15:19 <@sdumitriu> And since libraries sometimes change their APIs, we could end up with broken calls  
15:20 <@sdumitriu> Right  
15:20 <+sburjan> ok, I understand. thanks :)  
15:27 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:41 <polx> has quit  
15:41 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: Can you check why repository tests are failing?  
15:41 <@sdumitriu> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-repository-tests/  
15:45 <mflorea> has quit  
15:47 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: could you tell me in which space are the Macros in XE ? I am searching especially the RSS one  
15:47 <@sdumitriu> The RSS macro is a java one  
15:47 <@sdumitriu> So it's not in the wiki  
15:48 <+sburjan> okay, I wanted to try an improvement :)  
15:54 <vmassol> sburjan: what improvement?  
15:55 <+sburjan> when I add the RSS feed as a widget to my dashboard, it doesn't use the full witdh of the column, making it a little but unaesthetic.  
15:56 <+sburjan> because other macros like, info, warning, etc.. use the full width of the column, making them to look nice and integrated  
15:56 <+sburjan> I can send you a screenshot if you want to see  
16:05 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: yep seen it. Finished my work on LDAP i'm moving to XR now anyway  
16:05 <tmortagne> has quit  
16:05 <vmassol> sburjan: otp  
16:06 <vmassol> sburjan: you could start by opening a jira issue  
16:06 <vmassol> (and posting the screenshot there)  
16:06 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
16:08 <vmassol> sdumitriu: do we still want to support toucan? (don't remember the emails). For ex: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6440# ?  
16:14 <@sdumitriu> No decision on this topic yet  
16:15 <vmassol> k  
16:15 <@sdumitriu> Officially, it's still supported  
16:15 <@sdumitriu> We could start a vote  
16:15 <@sdumitriu> Maybe for 4.0  
16:15 <vmassol> yes  
16:24 <+sburjan> vmassol: I am gonna try to fix this, in order to get a little bit more familiar with the platform. http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7070  
16:31 <lucaa> has quit  
16:35 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
16:36 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
16:37 <polx> has quit  
16:39 <vmassol> sburjan: ok, then assign it to you maybe?  
16:40 <+sburjan> afaics it is only one line which has to be modified. assigning it to me  
16:40 <lucaa> has quit  
16:41 <vmassol> sburjan: AFAIK there's a width param  
16:41 <vmassol> have you tried using width="100%"?  
16:41 <+sburjan> yepp.  
16:41 <vmassol> doesn't work?  
16:41 <+sburjan> no, I removed width. and it look ok now  
16:41 <+sburjan> \*looks  
16:41 <vmassol> errr?  
16:42 <vmassol> width param is not by default  
16:42 <vmassol> you have to use it as a user to use it  
16:42 <@sdumitriu> Not the param, the css property  
16:42 <@sdumitriu> In colibri.css  
16:43 <vmassol> so the jira issue is incorrect and it's not a RSS macro issue?  
16:44 <+sburjan> line 1957 in cloibri.css  it is under rssfeed classname  
16:44 <vmassol> ok so it's not a RSS macro issue  
16:45 <vmassol> you should open a new issue and mark this one as duplicate  
16:45 <+sburjan> well it's the UI of RSS macro :) Wouldn't be easier if I modify the existing one ?  
16:46 <vmassol> you can  
16:46 <vmassol> it's not the UI of the RSS macro  
16:46 <vmassol> rss macro is in platform-rendering  
16:46 <vmassol> colibri is in platform-colibri  
16:46 <vmassol> two separate modules  
16:46 <vmassol> and different jira components  
16:47 <+sburjan> I know. I was going for RSS macro because from a user POV, the RSS macro is affected :) ok, modifying the desc  to colibri  
16:47 <vmassol> sure  
16:47 <vmassol> you can keep it from a user POV I'm fine with that  
16:48 <vmassol> just pick the right jira component  
16:48 <vmassol> so for me it's ok to keep the same title  
16:48 <+sburjan> I know they are in diferent modules, but I though that ifa user searches jira, he will search for RSS not for Colibri  
16:49 <+sburjan> vmassol: opdated the component to Colibri skin  
16:49 <vmassol> yes I agree with you  
16:49 <vmassol> I see "http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI/component/10022"  
16:50 <+sburjan> refresh :)  
16:50 <vmassol> it's ok now :)  
16:50 <vmassol> perfect  
16:51 <vmassol> now the question is why we put this in the colibri css....  
16:51 <vmassol> (ie whether changing it will break something else)  
16:51 <+sburjan> ok, so I removed the width because we shouldn't have any hardcoded width because the layout can change 1,2,3,4 columns  
16:52 <+sburjan> I don't know what else could use :.rssfeed { class  
16:52 <vmassol> so it means that now by default when you use the rss macro in a page it'll take the full width?  
16:54 <+sburjan> seems so, now it breaks this usecase :)  
16:55 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
16:55 <+sburjan> (thinking), but without adding a width param (optional) I don't see any other solution  
16:56 <vmassol> AFAIK in standard HTML only the width needed is used  
16:56 <vmassol> anyway I'll let you work on this issue  
16:57 <+sburjan> yes but this look very bad in dashboard.  
16:57 <vmassol> but the user can use width=100%  
16:58 <+sburjan> so you're ok with it ? removeing that line and make user specify width fomr WYSIWYG ?  
17:01 <+sburjan> yes, you're right.  I understand now  
17:06 <kwoot> has quit  
17:27 <vmassol> anyone has any idea why the activity stream on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/News isn't working?  
17:27 <vmassol> it's only listing entries from the main wiki  
17:28 <vmassol> but the code uses:  
17:28 <vmassol> {{activity entries="50" wikis=""xwiki,platform,enterprise,manager,extensions,dev,watch,xeclipse,xoffice,contrib" rss="true"/}}  
17:29 <vmassol> hmm I see a double suote used  
17:29 <vmassol> \*quote  
17:29 <vmassol> ah  
17:29 <vmassol> much better :)  
17:33 <vmassol> sburjan: would be nice if you had an avatar on xwiki.org ;)  
17:34 <vmassol> (would display better on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/News )  
17:34 <vmassol> (same for Enygma`)  
17:36 <+sburjan> vmassol: ok, I will have to find something, I have to put an avatar on a lot of places :)  
17:36 <vmassol> actually  
17:37 <vmassol> in the future, would be nice to allow supporting gravatar in the AS  
17:37 <+sburjan> +1 for that.  
17:37 <vmassol> hmm I can do that already  
17:37 <+sburjan> one avatar to update all :)  
17:37 <vmassol> I can run my script  
17:38 <vmassol> going to take a long time, I should restrict it to committers group probably initially  
17:38 <vmassol> I'm reffering to http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Gravatar+Import  
17:39 <+sburjan> I guess if we want to integrate gravatar support in platform, we'll need to add a checkbox on user profile page. something like. Use my uploaded page/User my gravatar pic  
17:39 <vmassol> although in the future it would be best to query gravatar and not hardcode it  
17:39 <vmassol> yep  
17:45 <vmassol> ok we new have an avatar for our irc bot ;)  
17:45 <@sdumitriu>  vmassol: Did you create the IRCBot user?  
17:45 <vmassol> yes  
17:46 <+sburjan> :)  
17:46 <vmassol> feel free to update its avatar image if you find a better one  
17:47 <+sburjan> a darth vader image :D  
17:47 <vmassol> why do you see the bot negatively? :)  
17:47 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
17:47 <+sburjan> then a Yoda image ? :)  
17:50 <+sburjan> I see that JIRA doesn;t support gravatar :)  
17:56 <Enygma`> has quit  
18:00 <vmassol> sburjan: you now have a nice avatar ;)  
18:04 <+sburjan> vmassol: thanks :D I'm gonna use it on skype also :P  
18:05 <vmassol> err please no  
18:05 <vmassol> :)  
18:05 <vmassol> not for skype  
18:05 <+sburjan> although I don't know what creature is that :D

18:06 <+sburjan> have a nice evening :)  
18:06 <vmassol> thks
